definition: to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: I'm steaming mad at him because he always enters into rivalry with me.
sentences.chinese: 他總是和我唱對臺戲，氣得我要命。

sentences.english: The kids always sided with their mother against me.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們總是和媽媽站在一起，跟我唱對臺戲。

sentences.english: They challenge us with opposing views.
